sentences.english: English is the language of business, technology, international politics, and entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 英語已經成爲了商務技術，國際政治和娛樂界的語言。

sentences.english: Hong Kong actor HIV Y rumors, has recently swept the entertainment industry.
sentences.chinese: 香港Y男星艾滋傳聞，最近正席捲娛樂界。

sentences.english: Li Chen and Fan Bingbing have fallen in love with each other, making (make) a hot topic in the entertainment industry.
sentences.chinese: 李晨和范冰冰相愛了，這成了娛樂界的一個熱門話題。

sentences.english: Award nominees were chosen by people from all areas of the entertainment industry.
sentences.chinese: 入圍者是由娛樂界各領域中的人所遴選出來。

sentences.english: In the field of entertainment, our culture glorifies celebrities.
sentences.chinese: 在娛樂界名人，我們的文化歌頌。

sentences.english: But after that, I decided to step away from the Hong Kong entertainment industry.
sentences.chinese: 但是這之後，我決定從香港娛樂界推出一段時間。

sentences.english: It's good to be the King of Hollywood — of the entertainment world.
sentences.chinese: 做好萊塢乃至娛樂界之王的感覺自然是好。

definition: the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
